alert.note: Alert for Little River; Miller (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 20 at 10:38PM CDT until April 20 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN LITTLE RIVER, NORTHWESTERN MILLER AND SOUTHEASTERN BOWIE COUNTIES... At 1038 PM CDT, local law enforcement reported that water is receding but there are still some roads that have standing water in rural areas. Up to 5 inches of rain have fallen over the past 3 hours. The Flash Flood threat continues. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Texarkana, Wake Village, Nash, Hooks, Redwater, Red Lick, Mandeville, Genoa, Leary and Mount Pleasant. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
